title: Modeling a Periodic Context - Robotic Arm

content.description:
The robotic arm is rectangular in shape and is labeled Arm.

The arm is attached to a circular piece that allows the arm to rotate in a counterclockwise, circular motion.

Attached to the circular piece is a rectangular base that extends to the level surface.

There are several labels in the figure.

Point S is on the tip of the Arm.

Point X is on the base.

The Counterclockwise rotation direction for the Arm is indicated with a dashed circle.

The vertical distance between point X and point S is labeled Height Above X.

The vertical distance from point X to the highest point on the dashed circle, located above X, is 20.

The vertical distance from point X to the lowest point on the dashed circle, located below X, is negative 6.

Note that the figure is not drawn to scale.

The figure shows a robotic arm rotating in a circular counterclockwise direction that completes one rotation every <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> seconds. Point <math alttext="S"><mi>S</mi></math> is on the tip of the arm, and point <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math> does not move. As the arm rotates at a constant speed, the height of <math alttext="S"><mi>S</mi></math> above <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math> periodically increases and decreases. At time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> seconds, <math alttext="S"><mi>S</mi></math> is at its lowest position, <math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math> inches directly below <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math>. At its highest position, <math alttext="S"><mi>S</mi></math> is <math alttext="20"><mn>20</mn></math> inches directly above <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math>. 

The sinusoidal function <math> <mi>h</mi> </math> models the height of <math alttext="S"> <mi>S</mi> </math> above <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math>, in inches, as a function of time <math> <mi>t</mi> </math>, in seconds. A positive value of <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </math> indicates <math alttext="S"><mi>S</mi></math> is above <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math>; a negative value of <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> indicates <math alttext="S"><mi>S</mi></math> is below <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math>.
content.question:
Part A

The graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented.

Determine possible coordinates <math> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> for the five points: <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>.

Moving from left to right:

Point F is at a maximum point.

Point G is on the midline.

Point J is at a minimum point.

Point K is on the midline.

Point P is at a maximum point.

frqParts.text:
Part A

The graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented.

Determine possible coordinates <math> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> for the five points: <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>.

Moving from left to right:

Point F is at a maximum point.

Point G is on the midline.

Point J is at a minimum point.

Point K is on the midline.

Point P is at a maximum point.

Part B

The function <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> can be written in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>cos</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@494E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find values of constants <math> <semantics> <mi>a</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>b</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>c</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mi>d</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

Part C

Refer to the graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in part (A). The <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-coordinate of <math> <semantics> <mi>K</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDamaaBaaaleaacaaIXaaabeaaaaa@3978@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-coordinate of <math> <mi>P</mi> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDamaaBaaaleaacaaIXaaabeaaaaa@3978@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D76@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

<math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is positive and increasing.

<math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is positive and decreasing.

<math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is negative and increasing.

<math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is negative and decreasing.

(ii) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D76@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, describe the concavity of the graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and determine whether the rate of change of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is increasing or decreasing.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
